info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 7:55PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Brewster County through 845 PM CDT... At 755 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northwest of Persimmon Gap, or 35 miles north of Panther Junction, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santiago Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
